goal.tools.errorhandling

Class GOALBugReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.LogRecord
      • goal.tools.logging.GOALLogRecord
        • goal.tools.errorhandling.GOALBugReport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GOALBugReport
extends GOALLogRecord

    A slight variation on the Warning class, GOALBugReport handles the display of GOAL bugs that occurred while running a multi-agent system. These are errors that seem to be a bug in the core, not a error by the user.

    Instead of printing the text 'Warning' this class prints the message 'GOAL BUG'.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GOALBugReport

        public GOALBugReport(java.lang.String message)
        Displays report of the error to the user.

        If this is the first time in this session that the given message is shown, the stack trace (if available) will be printed. If the same message is displayed again, the stack trace is only printed if #alwaysShowStackTrace is set to true

        Parameters:
        message - The error message to report to the user. Is prefixed with 'Runtime error: '.

      • GOALBugReport

        public GOALBugReport(java.lang.String message,
             java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Displays a new bug report to the user. If this is the first time in this session that the given message is shown, the stack trace (if available) will be printed. If the same message is displayed again, the stack trace is only printed if #alwaysShowStackTrace is set to true
        Parameters:
        message - The bug-message to report to the user. When printed, is prefixed with 'BUG: '.
        cause - The reason the bug occurred, and/or an exception with more information about the bug. SHOULD NEVER BE NULL.
